entry.dcterms:title: TÁRKI Omnibusz 2002/8 Social-political attitudes among the Hungarian adult population and World Internet Project Hungary cross-sectional addition
entry.dcterms:creator: Zsadányi-Nagy, Csaba
entry.dcterms:subject: TÁRKI Joint Research Center TDATA-F42: TÁRKI Omnibusz 2002/8 Social-political attitudes among the Hungarian adult population and World Internet Project Hungary cross-sectional addition. data sheet. Version: 2007-01-19

entry.dcterms:subject: 2004-03-00: the labels of the data file are corrected and complemented
entry.dcterms:description: 1) subjective financial situation, economic expectations, satisfaction with the work of the government and opposition, satisfaction with democracy 2) popularity of politicians, party preferences 3) state support for families raising children 4) internet use, opinion about and use of infocommunication technologies, computer in the household, types of internet use, online purchase 5) knowledge and opinions about the tasks and activities of the Ministry of Telecommunications and Information Society, state participation in the field of informatics, state support of purchasing computers and using the internet, telework, internet access at home, knowledge about computer use, education in informatics, knowledge and opinions about operation systems, amount spent on using internet, nationality affiliation, disabled in the household
entry.dcterms:subject: income, property and savings
political institutions, public administration
mass political behavior, attitudes
political ideology
social welfare policy and systems
information society
person
survey data
panel

A multi-stage proportionally stratified random probability sample representative of the Hungarian adult population. Unsuccessful inquiries were substituted with supplementary addresses, where persons to be interviewed were selected on the basis of the Leslie Kish key.
face-to-face interview
block 1: A, block 2: A, block 3: A, block 4: A, block 5: B
